cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, turning north Wednesday evening and then north-northeast Thursday, tracking parallel to the Georgia coast and very near the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the South Carolina/North Carolina coast (near Cape Fear to Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to the North Carolina/Virginia border including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River SC to Surf City NC (Hurricane Warning); Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina, with greatest impacts expected along the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (84% chance) with a nearly 50% chance of reaching 50-kt (58-mph) sustained winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Thursday night into early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 4–7 ft above ground possible from the Savannah River to Cape Lookout, including the Cape Fear/Wilmington area, with large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: Expected 5–10 inches with isolated totals up to 15 inches, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, and a few tornadoes possible in coastal North Carolina Thursday into Friday.
